data.title: North Dallas, TX Pest Control
data.meta_description: North Dallas, TX Pest Control. Let our qualified Dallas-Fort Worth Pest Control company help you get your residential or commercial pest infestation under control. Call All-Safe Pest & Termite!
data.text:
Effective Pest Control In North Dallas, TX

North Dallas comprises several communities and neighborhoods in the greater Dallas, Texas metro area, including parts of Dallas, Collin, and Denton counties. In recent years, North Dallas has become a destination all its own, complete with attractions including the NorthPark Center, Galleria Dallas, Dallas Midtown, and more.

Unfortunately, as North Dallas communities thrive, so do the pest communities living just outside the suburbs and commercial areas. If you’re not careful, those pests could find your home, business, or property and decide to move in themselves. Rest assured, once they get settled, they will never leave on their own.

That’s where the team at All-Safe Pest and Termite comes in. No matter the shape or size of your infestation, we have the solution you need to get pest-free today and keep you pest-free tomorrow.

Residential Pest Control In North Dallas, TX

While North Dallas has steadily continued to become a more and more attractive place for people to live in recent years, it’s had the same effect on pests: the more people move in, the more opportunities for dangerous and destructive pests like rodents, ants, roaches, termites, and other pests will take to invade.

The bad news is that, as a North Dallas homeowner, your home holds everything a pest is looking for, and the climate of the area means that many of the worst pests in the region are potential problems all year round. The good news is that you have the professional team you need to help: All-Safe Pest & Termite.

Whether your home is currently under attack by pests or you want to make sure pests never become a problem in the future, the team at All-Safe has the tools to help. Contact us today for more information about our residential pest control programs.

Commercial Pest Control In North Dallas, TX

As a business owner, the last thing you want is a pest problem. Pests scare off customers, destroy property, and seriously strain workplace morale. Worse, if the news gets out that you have pests at your business, your reputation will take a serious, and sometimes permanent, hit.

Don’t leave your commercial property at the mercy of rodents, roaches, and other pests. The professionals at All-Safe Pest & Termite have the experience necessary to protect businesses and facilities of any shape and size. When you contact us for an inspection, we’ll work with you to develop a customized pest management solution that perfectly suits your unique needs.

Protect your products, facility, employees, and customers from the health threats and damages pests bring. Contact the professionals here at All-Safe for commercial pest control services today.

Can I Prevent Termite Damage To My North Dallas, TX Home?

Termites are among the very worst pests you can have. Responsible for billions of dollars in property damage every year in the United States alone, leaving your home unprotected from termites is a recipe for disaster.

Unfortunately, termites are tough to prevent for homeowners working on their own. Termites operate underground, out of sight, so you probably won’t even know you have an infestation until damage has already occurred. Worse, because they’re attracted to the very wood inside your home’s walls, floors, and foundations, you can’t just remove their potential food source like you can with other pests.

The solution lies with All-Safe Pest & Termite. With help from the Sentricon® System with Always Active™, our team of termite professionals can form a protective barrier around your home that will stop termites from getting inside and eliminate colonies in the area. Contact us today and find out how a professional termite treatment can save you time, money, and headaches.

Why Mosquitoes Are A Serious Problem For North Dallas, TX Residents

Mosquitoes: an annoying summertime nuisance, right? Yes, but they’re far more than that: mosquito bites can transmit serious viruses and diseases to humans, including West Nile virus, Zika virus, dengue, yellow fever, malaria, and more. Their ability to spread so many diseases makes them among the topmost deadly animals on the planet.

While these diseases are less prevalent in the United States, they still occur, and the bacteria and other potential microorganisms mosquitoes can spread should be avoided at all costs. Unfortunately, mosquitoes are difficult to eliminate once they become established in an area, especially for homeowners working on their own, in areas like North Dallas, where they thrive.

What’s the solution? Contact the mosquito control specialists at All-Safe for help. No matter the size of your mosquito problem, we have the solution, and we’ll work with you to keep your property protected from these buzzing, biting pests in the future. Contact us today for more information.

Acrobat Ants In North Dallas: Identification, Facts, & Control

There are many ant species in the North Dallas area. Some are dangerous because of their aggressiveness, the diseases they spread, stings and bites they deliver, the damage they cause, and other dangers. At the same time, other species are nuisance pests because they do not cause harm or threaten people. Acrobat ants fall into the latter category of nuisance pests.

Although they are not dangerous, acrobat ants, or any other species, are not welcome in residential properties. Here is what you should know about acrobat ants:

Identification

Acrobat ants are about 1/8 inch long and are typically yellowish-brown to black, but can be multicolored. They have a heart-shaped abdomen, six legs, antennae, and a stinger.

Facts

While they have a stinger, acrobat ants rarely sting people. However, they can sting, bite, and emit a foul odor when threatened.

Their name comes from the acrobatic move they can perform by raising their abdomen over the thorax and head. This move usually only happens when they are bothered.

Queen acrobat ants are larger than worker ants, growing to 3/8 inch long; worker ants grow to 1/8 inch.

Although they prefer to be outside, acrobat ants can make their way inside as they forage for food.

The preferred food source of acrobat ants is honeydew, a sugary liquid made by aphids, which are crop-damaging pests.

Control

For ants, correctly identifying the infesting species is essential to effective removal. Because of this, DIY pest control methods often do no work against acrobat ants and other species. Instead, using professional ant pest control services from All-Safe Pest & Termite will provide the results you need.

Ants are such a big problem during the summer months in Texas, so All-Safe Pest & Termite offers a targeted control process to eliminate and prevent this pest. Contact our team today to learn more about how we can assist with acrobat ants and other species.

A Handy Guide To American Cockroaches For North Dallas Homeowners

Cockroaches are a common home-invading pest. There are many species of cockroaches in our area, and identifying them is essential to performing the proper treatment methods. One of the types of cockroaches in North Dallas is the American cockroach. Here is a guide to everything you need to know about this pest:

Identification

American cockroaches are the largest home-invading species in North America, ranging between 1 1/4 to 2 1/8 inches long. They are a reddish-brown color and have a yellowish figure-eight pattern on the back of the head. Like other cockroaches, they have an oval-shaped body, six legs, and antennae. Although they have wings, American cockroaches can only fly short distances.

Dangers

As with other species, American cockroaches are capable of spreading many dangerous diseases, including, but not limited to salmonellosis, E. coli infection, typhoid fever, dysentery, and cholera. As they infest homes, cockroaches leave behind shed skin, carcasses, droppings, and saliva, which can cause contamination, trigger asthma, and irritate allergies. Although rare, American cockroaches can bite, causing irritation, swelling, and potentially leading to secondary infection.

Habitat

American cockroaches prefer warm, dark, and damp places. Outside, they live in sewers, near manhole covers, sump pumps, dumpsters, and landfills. This pest gravitates to crawl spaces, basements, bathrooms, and near drains when they make their way inside.

Behavior

In general, cockroaches are not picky eaters, consuming various things ranging from human food, leather, glue, decaying organic matter, and more. This kind of diet can lead to damage to furniture, floorings, personal belongings, and other items when American cockroaches infest. While they are voracious eaters, adult American cockroaches can survive for an extended time without eating.

Prevention

You can take four steps to help prevent the infestation of American cockroaches on your property.

Ensure there are no potential entryways by installing covers on drains, vents, and sewers; repairing damaged screens and weather stripping; sealing cracks in the foundation and other weaknesses in the home’s exterior, including along the roofline.

Keep the interior and exterior clear of food sources like crumbs, dirty dishes, pet food, garbage cans without lids, and fallen fruit.

Reduce moisture in your yard and home by removing organic debris, keeping gutters unclogged, repairing leaks, fixing poor ventilation, and using dehumidifiers.

Keep your home and yard decluttered and organized to eliminate harborage areas and make it easier to clean.

Control
